title: Implementing Cryo-EM Manual Plunger Techniques in University Workshops and Teaching Laboratories
content: Cryogenic Electron Microscopy (Cryo-EM) is a powerful technique that allows for the structural characterization of biological macromolecules in a “near-native” state. To date, students who wish to pursue Cryo-EM as a field of study have access to many online courses such as CryoEM101.com, Caltech, ThermoFischer, and training offered by national labs such as PNCC, NCCAT, and S2C2. Unfortunately, the costs associated with acquiring instrumentation, along with their maintenance, can prohibit universities from designing hands-on undergraduate courses in the workflow. This presents an opportunity to design a classroom that can introduce students to the Cryo-EM workflow in a cost-effective and hands-on manner.
